mnd16:250.18: the Blessed One; or "the Blessed One is the one who divides the four
mnd16:250.19: mindfulness, the four righteousness, the four bases, the five roots, the five
mnd16:250.20: powers, the seven enlightenment factors, and the eight branches of the holy
mnd16:250.21: path." The Blessed One is the one who has ten Tathāgata strength, four
mnd16:250.22: fearlessness, four unobstructed solutions, six magical powers, and six
mnd16:250.23: enlightenment methods." The Blessed One is the Blessed One. "The Blessed One,"
mnd16:250.24: this name is not given (made) by the mother; not given by the father; not given
mnd16:250.25: by brothers; not by sisters; not by friends; not by relatives; not by Samaṇas or
mnd16:250.26: Brāhmaṇas; not by heaven. This is ultimate liberation; to Buddha, the World
mnd16:250.27: Honored person, and under the Bodhi tree together with all the knowledge and
mnd16:250.28: wisdom gained and testimony, that is, the Blessed One.
